rows.name: text_top_1
rows.value:
For someone good at adding, multiplying by 3 and 4 can be quick and easy.

Multiplying a number by 3 is adding the number to double the number. So, 3 x 6 is 6 more than double 6, which is 6 + 12.

Multiplying a number by 4 is doubling a number and doubling it again. So, 4 x 7 is 2 x (2 x 7), which is 14 + 14.

At this point, your child should be comfortable quickly doing all the multiplying up to 5 times 5, which is a huge leap forward!
